result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharice M. Banks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sharice M. Banks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sharice M. Banks was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Sharice M. Banks was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Sharice M. Banks was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively maintain employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May have contact with children as provided in the Chips action. Comply with orders in 22JC43/44/45/46/47

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Judge Kluka acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Smathers appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Toni Young.  SW - Rachel Bellaire present.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  Amended information filed by the State.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information and waives the reading.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 3, 4, & 5; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  DNA ordered.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, credit for 2 days is requested.
NO RECORD MADE.  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Young appears on behalf of DE. DE appearance waived.  Clerk. M.Burke. PLEAH set to 06/21/22 at 3:30.
on request of defense counsel, plea hrg set for 6/2 @ 2:15pm
Plea hearing on June 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant, Sharice M. Banks, appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
